content.purpose: Add end-to-end (E2E) tests for the Memory Bank CLI to ensure all commands function correctly in a real-world environment.

userStory.problem: Currently, there are no automated E2E tests for the CLI, making it difficult to verify that CLI commands work as expected across different environments and with various inputs.
features: Create test infrastructure for CLI command execution
Implement E2E tests for all CLI command groups
Verify both happy paths and error handling
Ensure reliable test execution in CI/CD pipelines
userStory.expectedBehavior: All CLI commands should be thoroughly tested to ensure they behave as expected with various inputs and in different scenarios.

goals: Create a robust test infrastructure for CLI command testing
Implement comprehensive test coverage for all CLI commands
Ensure tests run reliably in CI/CD environments
Provide clear test output and helpful diagnostics
constraints: Tests must be independent and not interfere with each other
Tests should clean up after themselves to avoid side effects
Test environments should mimic real-world usage as closely as possible
stakeholders: Developers who use the CLI for Memory Bank operations
Contributors who need to ensure their changes don't break existing functionality
CI/CD pipeline maintainers who need reliable automated tests
relatedWork: E2E test strategy document in global memory bank
